title: Update navigation hierarchy: nest Compliance under Client Portal and Compliance Admin under Admin menu

requirements.text: In the Navigation component, move the 'Compliance' link so it appears as a nested item under the 'Client Portal' section (visible to authenticated, approved users). It should no longer appear as a top-level navigation item.

quotes: place Compliance within the Client Portal

acceptanceCriteria: The 'Compliance' link is no longer rendered as a standalone top-level nav item.
The 'Compliance' link appears grouped under or within the 'Client Portal' navigation section in both desktop and mobile menus.
Clicking 'Compliance' still navigates to the compliance dashboard page.
Visibility rules (authenticated + approved users only) are preserved.

requirements.text: In the Navigation component, move the 'Compliance Admin' link so it appears as a nested item under the 'Admin' menu section (visible to admin users only). It should no longer appear as a top-level navigation item.

quotes: Compliance Admin within the Admin menu

acceptanceCriteria: The 'Compliance Admin' link is no longer rendered as a standalone top-level nav item.
The 'Compliance Admin' link appears grouped under or within the 'Admin' navigation section in both desktop and mobile menus.
Clicking 'Compliance Admin' still navigates to the compliance admin dashboard page.
Visibility is restricted to admin users only (consistent with AdminGuard logic).

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not change routing definitions or page components â€” only the Navigation component's link hierarchy.
Preserve all existing authentication and role-based visibility rules.
nonGoals: Changing the admin guard or authentication logic.
Modifying any page-level components other than Navigation.
